author: David E. Sanger
description: The decision to launch a full-on attack on Iran would be in the gray area between the president’s powers as commander in chief and the Constitution’s mandate that only Congress can declare war.
title: Trump Calls for Iran’s ‘Unconditional Surrender’ and Threatens Its Supreme Leader

author: Saher Alghorra and Neil Vigdor
description: A convoy of trucks brought food parcels into the territory, where civilians are at risk of starvation and have been suffering worsening conditions, with such aid shipments rare in recent weeks.
title: Humanitarian Aid Trickles Into Northern Gaza

author: Hiroko Tabuchi
description: The company, xAI, has installed several dozen turbines in Memphis without proper permits, the group said, polluting a nearby community.
title: Elon Musk’s AI Company Faces Lawsuit Over Gas-Burning Turbines

author: Natan Odenheimer, David E. Sanger, Farnaz Fassihi and Michael Levenson
description: Maj. Gen. Ali Shadmani had been in the job for mere days. News of his death came as President Trump called for Iran’s “unconditional surrender” and threatened its supreme leader.
title: Israel Says It Killed a Top Iranian Military Leader as Trump Calls for Iran’s Surrender

author: Daniel E. Slotnik
description: Plus, Octopuses’ marvelous arms.
title: Wednesday Briefing: Trump Calls for Iran’s ‘Unconditional Surrender’

author: Julian E. Barnes, Farnaz Fassihi, Eric Schmitt and Helene Cooper
description: American commanders have put troops on high alert throughout the region as fears of a wider war grow.
title: Iran Is Preparing Missiles for Possible Retaliatory Strikes on U.S. Bases, Officials Say

author: Euan Ward
description: The cleric has ruled for more than three decades, spearheading a policy of backing proxy groups to wield influence across the Middle East.
title: Who Is Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran’s Supreme Leader?

author: Robert Jimison
description: A bipartisan pair in the House and a Democrat in the Senate have moved to force votes in the coming days on requiring congressional approval before U.S. troops could take offensive action against Iran.
title: War Powers Debate Revived in Congress as Trump Threatens Iran

author: Euan Ward
description: The cleric has ruled for more than three decades, spearheading a policy of backing proxy groups to wield influence across the Middle East.
title: Who Is Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, Iran’s Supreme Leader?

author: Natan Odenheimer
description: Iran has sharply reduced its missile fire on Israel, possibly signaling a shift to a drawn-out, lower-intensity conflict
title: Iran has reduced missile fire at Israel, which may be part strategy, part necessity.

author: Farnaz Fassihi and Parin Behrooz
description: Many people believed the government was responsible for restricting services, and the authorities were urging Iranians to use the national internet network.
title: The internet across Iran is being disrupted, experts and Iranians say.

author: Frances Robles
description: Two politicians who spoke out against recent accords between the United States and Panama lost their permission to travel to the United States.
title: U.S. Revokes Visa of Former Panamanian President Who Criticized Trump Deal

author: Leily Nikounazar and Talya Minsberg
description: Cars lined up at a gas station Monday in Tehran.
title: As Israel attacks, Iranians flee capital in search of safety.

author: Victor Mather
description: There were no immediate reports of injury after Mount Lewotobi Laki-laki ejected a plume of smoke and ashes on Tuesday night. An eruption there killed 10 people last year.
title: Mount Lewotobi Volcano Erupts in Indonesia, Spewing Ash Miles High

author: Euan Ward
description: Hezbollah, Iran’s most powerful regional ally, has signaled privately that it does not intend to attack Israel, but Lebanon’s military has bolstered its presence in the country’s south to prevent rocket fire.
title: Lebanon, Eager to Stay Out of Israel-Iran War, Warns Hezbollah Not to Join the Fight

author: Lara Jakes
description: Since shortly after it was founded in 1948, Israel has been intent on building a nuclear program to ensure its survival.
title: What to Know About Israel’s Secretive Nuclear Weapons Program

author: David E. Sanger
description: The president wrote in a social media post that the United States knew his location.
title: Trump calls for Iran’s ‘unconditional surrender’ and threatens its supreme leader.

author: Anton Troianovski
description: Thousands of North Korean laborers are already toiling in Russia. A new contingent is headed to the region where North Korean troops fought Ukraine.
title: North Korea Will Send 5,000 Workers to Russia, Kremlin Says

author: Michael Crowley
description: Israel’s military campaign reminds some of America’s ill-fated Middle East interventions, which President Trump has long denounced.
title: ‘Regime Change’? Questions About Israel’s Iran Goal Pressure Trump

author: Elena Shao
title: Here’s a look at the first four days of attacks between Israel and Iran.

author: Lazaro Gamio and Karen Yourish
description: TK summary test.
title: There are more than 40 nuclear and missile facilities throughout Iran.

author: Stephen Castle
description: British lawmakers will debate possible legislation to prevent women from being criminally prosecuted for ending their pregnancies.
title: Is Abortion Legal in the UK? What to Know About the Law and Proposed Changes

author: Jonathan Swan, Maggie Haberman, Mark Mazzetti and Ronen Bergman
description: President Trump spent the first months of his term holding back Israel’s push for an assault on Iran’s nuclear program. With the war underway, his posture has gyrated as he weighs sending in the U.S. military.
title: How Trump Shifted on Iran Under Pressure From Israel

author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg
description: The International Atomic Energy Agency had initially said that the Friday attack had destroyed the aboveground part of the Natanz fuel enrichment plant, but its latest statement indicates more significant damage.
title: Underground Halls at Iran’s Natanz Nuclear Site Suffered ‘Direct Impacts’ From Israel Strikes, U.N. Atomic Watchdog Says

author: Claire Moses
description: They came. They sat. They left.
title: Visitors Break Crystal Chair in Sit-and-Run at Italian Museum

author: Jenny Gross
description: Between 100,000 and 150,000 Israelis have been stuck abroad as the country’s airspace remains closed and the fighting with Iran drags on.
title: Israeli Airline Will Bring Back Stranded Israeli Travelers

author: Paul Sonne
description: Analysts say the Kremlin is prioritizing its own war against Ukraine, as well as its relations with Gulf nations that don’t want to see a stronger Iran.
title: Russia Stands Aside as Israel Attacks Iran

author: Hiroko Tabuchi and Ken Belson
description: Four experts were sued for defamation ahead of a seminar where they planned to talk about research into the potential health risks on playgrounds and sports fields nationwide.
title: Is Fake Grass Safe? A Manufacturer Sues to Stop a Discussion.

author: Adam Rasgon
description: President Trump’s contradictory comments left Israelis and Iranians trying to understand whether and how the U.S. would intervene.
title: Trump Offers Mixed Messages on Israel-Iran War

author: Mark Landler
description: The British prime minister scrambled at President Trump’s feet in a viral moment, but he may be happier than the other Group of 7 leaders with his moment in the sun.
title: At G7 Summit With Trump, Starmer Picks Up Papers and Political Wins for U.K.

author: Rawan Sheikh Ahmad and Abu Bakr Bashir
description: With the international community distracted by the new Middle East conflict between Israel and Iran, ongoing bloodshed in Gaza is drawing less attention.
title: As World Turns Focus to Iran, Lethal Violence Flares at Gaza Aid Sites

author: Roger Cohen
description: In an angry post on social media, President Trump suggested that President Emmanuel Macron of France was a publicity seeker with no clue about American plans in the Israel-Iran conflict.
title: Trump Says Macron ‘Always Gets It Wrong’ as They Clash Over Mideast

author: Roger Cohen
description: In an angry post on social media, President Trump suggested that President Emmanuel Macron of France was a publicity seeker with no clue about American plans in the Israel-Iran conflict.
title: Trump Says Macron ‘Always Gets It Wrong’ as They Clash Over Mideast

author: Amelia Nierenberg
description: Israeli c
title: Who Is Ali Shadmani, the Iranian Military Leader Israel Said It Killed?

author: Matthew Mpoke Bigg
description: Both countries have closed their airspaces, leaving few options for citizens of other countries seeking to leave.
title: Which Countries Have Issued Travel Advisories for Israel and Iran?

author: Choe Sang-Hun
description: Officials drastically understated outbreaks and deaths, depriving citizens of help, two U.S. research groups report, citing interviews with people inside North Korea.
title: North Korea’s Pandemic ‘Miracle’ Was a Deadly Lie, Report Says

author: The New York Times
description: President Trump left early from the G7 summit and said he was working on something “much bigger” than a cease-fire. Israel said it had killed another senior Iranian general on the fifth day of the war.
title: Live Updates: Trump Returns to D.C. as Israel and Iran Trade Attacks

author: Michael D. Shear, Zolan Kanno-Youngs and Francesca Regalado
title: Here’s the latest.

author: Christina Goldbaum
description: Syria was once among the closest allies of the Islamic republic, but the new government resents Tehran’s support for the Assad regime and has pledged not to allow attacks on Israel from its territory.
title: Syria Is Notably Silent as Other Arab States Condemn Israeli Attacks on Iran

author: Frances Robles
description: The Haitian government has turned to drones to go after gang leaders who have captured much of the capital. But legal experts say that violates international law.
title: Haiti is Using Drones to Fight Gangs. Here’s Why That’s Likely Illegal.

author: Constant Méheut
description: It was one of the deadliest attacks on the Ukrainian capital in months that came as Moscow has intensified air assaults on the city.
title: Russian Drone and Missile Strikes on Kyiv Kill at Least 14

author: Stephanie Nolen
description: The budget cuts threaten global progress on everything from heart disease to H.I.V. — and could affect American drug companies, too.
title: South Africa Built a Medical Research Powerhouse. Trump Cuts Have Demolished It.

author: Lizzie Dearden
description: A review of Britain’s so-called grooming gangs scandal had recommended the move, saying that an information “vacuum” had allowed people to “sow and spread hatred.”
title: UK to Collect Ethnicity Data on All Suspects of Child Sexual Abuse

author: Alexandra Stevenson
description: As President Trump’s tariffs close off the U.S. market, Chinese goods are flooding countries from Southeast Asia to Europe to Latin America.
title: China Is Unleashing a New Export Shock on the World

author: Aaron Boxerman, Farnaz Fassihi, Aric Toler and Sanjana Varghese
description: A news anchor was speaking when an explosion shook the building, followed by the sound of breaking glass and screams, all carried on television.
title: Israel Attacks Iran’s State Television, Live On The Air

author: Erica L. Green and Zolan Kanno-Youngs
description: President Trump opened his remarks at the Group of 7 gathering of industrialized nations by criticizing the decision to expel Russia from the bloc after Moscow’s 2014 “annexation” of Crimea.
title: At G7, Trump Renews Embrace of Putin Amid Rift With Allies

author: Matina Stevis-Gridneff and Zolan Kanno-Youngs
description: Canada’s prime minister Mark Carney deployed both methods on the first day of the Group of 7 summit in Alberta to keep Mr. Trump focused and avoid drama.
title: Flattery or Discipline? The Difficult Task of Managing Trump.

author: Matina Stevis-Gridneff and Zolan Kanno-Youngs
description: Canada’s prime minister Mark Carney deployed both methods on the first day of the Group of 7 summit in Alberta to keep Mr. Trump focused and avoid drama.
title: Flattery or Discipline? The Difficult Task of Managing Trump.
